CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1949, p. 13, reads: "Centre Avenue Station Reopens - The racially mixed staff which appears in top left photo looked across the desk at the six white men, one colored women, and one white woman who appears for hearings at Centre Avenue Station on Tuesday morning following the reopening ceremonies at the station Monday night. They were the main reason for the rejoicing in the Negro community at the reopening ceremony for a remodeled 'lockup.'... Bottom right photo: Eunice Cook of Hill City inspects linens of bed in one of Centre Avenue Station's new hospital cells... Other photos by Charles Harris."
TitMainTitle: Eunice Cook inspecting bed in jail cell at Centre Avenue police station
